Articles.Content:
The Orion spaceraft is nasas next generation spacecraft it will be launched on SLS.

Download: [http://www./download/o9vjsxt1tioy0q8/Orion.craft](http://www./download/o9vjsxt1tioy0q8/Orion.craft)

The back of the craft looks weird

Nice job though !

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-07T11:33:09Z" title="06/07/2015 11:33  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 7, 2015</time> by Andiron**

Not to complain, but it might be a good idea to create a company in the RB subforum to keep your crafts neat and tidy in one place.

Also nice Orion, first one I've seen using the Poodle.

I did but no one posted on it so it's a few pages back. ![:rolleyes:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_rolleyes.gif)

- - - Updated - - -

Whats looks weird. And what is tech specs?

Multiple fuel tanks

tech specs are technical specifications (Mass, DeltaV, Thrust,...)

So what i should use a 2.5 metre fuel tank? that would look horrible

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-07T11:56:10Z" title="06/07/2015 11:56  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 7, 2015</time> by Lime**

> 
> So what i should use a 2.5 metre fuel tank? that would look horrible

I agree, but I like the "Mad rocket scientist" version with a fairing to cover it 

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/124472-Constellation-Mission-Packs-Discussion-Thread%21](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/124472-Constellation-Mission-Packs-Discussion-Thread%21)
So i should cover the engine and fuel tanks with a fairing?

> 
> So i should cover the engine and fuel tanks with a fairing?

Not necessarilly, I like it like that but it's my opinion. 

You can put the engine a little bit behind for exemple.

Ã¢â‚¬â€¹Your craft is good nonetheless
The engine is put inside the tank using the offset tool. And let me guess you dont like part clipping.

> 
> The engine is put inside the tank using the offset tool. And let me guess you dont like part clipping.

Part clipping is very useful in KSP to make stock crafts and I like its possibilities

> 
> Not to complain, but it might be a good idea to create a company in the RB subforum to keep your crafts neat and tidy in one place.
> Also nice Orion, first one I've seen using the Poodle.

Actually, my one does if you look back.

Nice Orion though, we had almost the same idea!
